URI Template URI Template
draft-gregorio-uritemplate-06 draft-gregorio-uritemplate-07
Abstract Abstract
A URI Template is a compact sequence of characters for describing a A URI Template is a compact sequence of characters for describing a
range of Uniform Resource Identifiers through variable expansion. range of Uniform Resource Identifiers through variable expansion.
This specification defines the URI Template syntax and the process This specification defines the URI Template syntax and the process
for expanding a URI Template into a URI reference, along with for expanding a URI Template into a URI reference, along with
guidelines for the use of URI Templates on the Internet. guidelines for the use of URI Templates on the Internet.

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
1.1. Overview 1.1. Overview
A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) [RFC3986] is often used to A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) [RFC3986] is often used to
identify a specific resource within a common space of similar identify a specific resource within a common space of similar
resources. For example, personal web spaces are often delegated resources. For example, personal web spaces are often delegated
using a common pattern, such as using a common pattern, such as
skipping to change at page 5, line 12 skipping to change at page 4, line 12
expressions and substituting each one with its corresponding expressions and substituting each one with its corresponding
expansion. expansion.
A URI Template provides both a structural description of a URI space A URI Template provides both a structural description of a URI space
and, when variable values are provided, machine-readable instructions and, when variable values are provided, machine-readable instructions
on how to construct a URI corresponding to those values. A URI on how to construct a URI corresponding to those values. A URI
Template is transformed into a URI-reference by replacing each Template is transformed into a URI-reference by replacing each
delimited expression with its value as defined by the expression type delimited expression with its value as defined by the expression type
and the values of variables named within the expression. The and the values of variables named within the expression. The
expression types range from simple string expansion to multiple expression types range from simple string expansion to multiple
key=value lists. The expansions are based on the URI generic syntax, name=value lists. The expansions are based on the URI generic
allowing an implementation to process any URI Template without syntax, allowing an implementation to process any URI Template
knowing the scheme-specific requirements of every possible resulting without knowing the scheme-specific requirements of every possible
URI. resulting URI.
For example, the following URI Template includes a form-style For example, the following URI Template includes a form-style
parameter expression, as indicated by the "?" operator appearing parameter expression, as indicated by the "?" operator appearing
before the variable names. before the variable names.
http://www.example.com/foo{?query,number} http://www.example.com/foo{?query,number}
The expansion process for expressions beginning with the question- The expansion process for expressions beginning with the question-
mark ("?") operator follows the same pattern as form-style interfaces mark ("?") operator follows the same pattern as form-style interfaces
on the World Wide Web: on the World Wide Web:

Since most template processors implemented prior to this Since most template processors implemented prior to this
specification have only implemented the default expression type, we specification have only implemented the default expression type, we
refer to these as Level 1 templates. refer to these as Level 1 templates.

Mechanisms similar to URI Templates have been defined within several Mechanisms similar to URI Templates have been defined within several
specifications, including WSDL, WADL and OpenSearch. This specifications, including WSDL, WADL and OpenSearch. This
specification extends and formally defines the syntax so that URI specification extends and formally defines the syntax so that URI

operators defined in Section 3 of this specification include: operators defined in Section 3 of this specification include:
+ Reserved character strings; + Reserved character strings;
# Fragment identifiers prefixed by "#"; # Fragment identifiers prefixed by "#";
. Name labels or extensions prefixed by "."; . Name labels or extensions prefixed by ".";
/ Path segments prefixed by "/"; / Path segments prefixed by "/";
; Path parameter key or key=value pairs prefixed by ";"; ; Path parameter name or name=value pairs prefixed by ";";
? Query component beginning with "?" and consisting of ? Query component beginning with "?" and consisting of
key=value pairs separated by "&"; and, name=value pairs separated by "&"; and,
& Continuation of query-style &key=value pairs within & Continuation of query-style &name=value pairs within
a literal query component. a literal query component.
The operator characters equals ("="), comma (","), exclamation ("!"), The operator characters equals ("="), comma (","), exclamation ("!"),
at-sign ("@"), and pipe ("|") are reserved for future extensions. at-sign ("@"), and pipe ("|") are reserved for future extensions.
The expression syntax specifically excludes use of the dollar ("$") The expression syntax specifically excludes use of the dollar ("$")
and parentheses ["(" and ")"] characters so that they remain and parentheses ["(" and ")"] characters so that they remain
available for local language extensions outside the scope of this available for local language extensions outside the scope of this
specification. specification.

2.4.2. Composite Values 2.4.2. Composite Values
An explode modifier ("*") indicates that the variable represents a An explode ("*") modifier indicates that the variable is to be
composite value that may be substituted in full or partial forms, treated as a composite value consisting of either a list of names or
depending on the variable's type and value set. Since URI Templates an associative array of (name, value) pairs. Hence, the expansion
do not contain an indication of type or schema, this is assumed to be process is applied to each member of the composite as if it were
determined by context. An example context is a mark-up element or listed as a separate variable. This kind of variable specification
header field that contains one attribute that is a template and one is significantly less self-documenting than non-exploded variables,
or more other attributes that define the schema applicable to since there is less correspondence between the variable name and how
variables found in the template. Likewise, a typed programming the URI reference appears after expansion.
language might differentiate variables as strings, lists, associative
arrays, or structures.
explode = "*" explode = "*"
Since URI Templates do not contain an indication of type or schema,
the type for an exploded variable is assumed to be determined by
context. For example, the processor might be supplied values in a
form that differentiates values as strings, lists, or associative
arrays. Likewise, the context in which the template is used (script,
mark-up language, IDL, etc.) might define rules for associating
variable names with types, structures, or schema.
Explode modifiers improve brevity in the URI Template syntax. For Explode modifiers improve brevity in the URI Template syntax. For
example, a resource that provides a geographic map for a given street example, a resource that provides a geographic map for a given street
address might accept a hundred permutations on fields for address address might accept a hundred permutations on fields for address
input, including partial addresses (e.g., just the city or postal input, including partial addresses (e.g., just the city or postal
code). Such a resource could be described as a template with each code). Such a resource could be described as a template with each
and every address component listed in order, or with a far more and every address component listed in order, or with a far more
simple template that makes use of an explode modifier, as in simple template that makes use of an explode modifier, as in
/mapper{?address*} /mapper{?address*}

3. Expansion 3. Expansion
The process of URI Template expansion is to scan the template string The process of URI Template expansion is to scan the template string
from beginning to end, copying literal characters and replacing each from beginning to end, copying literal characters and replacing each
expression with the result of applying the expression's operator to expression with the result of applying the expression's operator to
the value of each variable named in the expression. Each variable's the value of each variable named in the expression. Each variable's
value MUST be formed prior to template expansion. value MUST be formed prior to template expansion.
The requirements on expansion for each aspect of the URI Template
grammar are defined in this section. A non-normative algorithm for
the expansion process as a whole is provided in Appendix A.
If a template processor encounters an error outside of an expression, If a template processor encounters an error outside of an expression,
such as a character sequence that does not match the <URI-Template> such as a character sequence that does not match the <URI-Template>
grammar, then processing of the template SHOULD cease, the URI- grammar, then processing of the template SHOULD cease, the URI-
reference result SHOULD be undefined, and the location and type of reference result SHOULD contain the expanded part of the template
followed by the remainder unexpanded, and the location and type of
error SHOULD be indicated to the invoking application. If an error error SHOULD be indicated to the invoking application. If an error
is encountered inside an expression, such as an operator or value is encountered inside an expression, such as an operator or value
modifier that it does not recognize or cannot support, then the modifier that it does not recognize or cannot support, then the
expression SHOULD be copied to the result unexpanded, processing of expression SHOULD be copied to the result unexpanded, processing of
the remainder of the template SHOULD continue, and the location and the remainder of the template SHOULD continue, and the location and
type of error SHOULD be indicated to the invoking application. In type of error SHOULD be indicated to the invoking application. If an
this latter case, the result returned will not be a valid URI error occurs, the result returned might not be a valid URI reference;
reference; it will be an incompletely expanded template string that it will be an incompletely expanded template string that is only
is only intended for diagnostic use. intended for diagnostic use.
3.1. Literal Expansion 3.1. Literal Expansion
If the literal character is allowed anywhere in the URI syntax If the literal character is allowed anywhere in the URI syntax
(unreserved / reserved / pct-encoded ), then it is copied directly to (unreserved / reserved / pct-encoded ), then it is copied directly to
the result string. Otherwise, the pct-encoded equivalent of the the result string. Otherwise, the pct-encoded equivalent of the
literal character is copied to the result string by encoding the literal character is copied to the result string by encoding the
character in UTF-8 (a sequence of octets) and then encoding each character in UTF-8 (a sequence of octets) and then encoding each
octet as a pct-encoded triplet. octet as a pct-encoded triplet.

expansion decisions and skip to the next character for the variable- expansion decisions and skip to the next character for the variable-

type is simple string expansion and the first character is the type is simple string expansion and the first character is the
beginning of the variable-list. beginning of the variable-list.

For a variable that is a simple string value, expansion consists of For a variable that is a simple string value, expansion consists of
appending the encoded value to the result string. The explode appending the encoded value to the result string. The explode
modifier has no effect. The prefix modifier limits the expansion to modifier has no effect. The prefix modifier limits the expansion to
the first max-length characters of the decoded value. If the value the first max-length characters of the decoded value. If the value
contains multibyte UTF-8, care must be taken to avoid splitting the contains multibyte UTF-8, care must be taken to avoid splitting the
value in mid-character: count each Unicode codepoint as one value in mid-character: count each Unicode codepoint as one
character. character.
